subject: Education
title: The Montessori Method for Toddlers
description: A quick, practical guide to The Montessori Method for Toddlers.

hook.text: In a Montessori classroom, two-year-olds pour their own water, slice bananas, and choose their own work.

buildup.text: Maria Montessori, Italy's first female physician, designed her method by observing children, not lecturing them.

discovery.text: The key insight: children have natural sensitive periods for order, movement, language, and sensory refinement.

twist.text: Montessori classrooms have no rewards, no grades, and no punishmentsâ€”intrinsic motivation drives everything.

climax.text: Randomized studies show Montessori children outperform peers in reading, math, and social problem-solving.

punchline.text: Give children real tools and real choice, and they rise to the occasion.
